items.title: Viet Nam Day 2025: Experience Finland’s First and Largest Vietnam Festival on Saturday in Helsinki
items.summary: Viet Nam Day is anticipated to attract thousands of attendees through its rich cultural offerings, diverse food choices and networking opportunities.
items.source: Finland Today | News in English | finlandtoday.fi

items.title: Police Issue 400+ Fines to Drunk E-Scooter Drivers Since Mid-June
items.summary: The police have stayed vigilant with e-scooter drivers since the new law took effect.
items.source: Finland Today | News in English | finlandtoday.fi

items.title: Hot Weather Making a Comeback Next Week
items.summary: Finnish meteorologists are confident that heat will return to parts of Finland next week.
items.source: Finland Today | News in English | finlandtoday.fi

items.title: Nationwide Rail Passenger Information System Disruptions Resolved, According to Fintraffic
items.summary: Nationwide disruptions to the rail passenger information system led to inaccurate information being shown on station timetable displays. But, according to Fintraffic, the passenger information system has now been fixed.
items.source: Finland Today | News in English | finlandtoday.fi

items.title: Pori Jazz Festival Main Concerts Attract an Audience of 50,000
items.summary: From July 17 to 19, during the main festival days at Kirjurinluoto, a total of 50,000 guests attended the three major concerts. The attendance peaked at 25,000 on Saturday. Overall attendance for the festival amounted to 192,000.
items.source: Finland Today | News in English | finlandtoday.fi

items.title: Pori Jazz 2024: Rain or Shine, I’m Gonna Get Mine; GALLERY
items.summary: The 2024 Pori Jazz edition highlighted funky grooves and '80s nostalgia while showcasing top contemporary jazz artists on the southwestern coast in mid-July.
items.source: Finland Today | News in English | finlandtoday.fi

items.title: Mielen Silta ry – Building Bridges for Mental Well-Being
items.summary: Mielen Silta ry is the first Pakistani-founded NGO in Finland, created by Kashaf Ali in 2025 to support the mental well-being, emotional resilience, and social integration of families—especially immigrant mothers and children—through inclusive, multilingual support services. Mielen Silta ry operates three main programs: Päiväkodista nuoreen – From Daycare to YouthA nationwide bullying prevention initiative rooted […]
items.source: Finland Today | News in English | finlandtoday.fi

items.title: Today’s Heavy Metal: Embracing Evolution Beyond Double Kicks and Leather at Tuska 2025; GALLERY & REPORT
items.summary: Tuska 2025 attracted 60,000 visitors to Suvilahti, Helsinki. The festival featured various metal genres amid mixed summer weather, including sunshine and rain showers, with Sunday facing potential storms. Here’s our report.
items.source: Finland Today | News in English | finlandtoday.fi

items.title: Uncovering the Untold Stories Through Music: Finnish Migration to North America and Soviet Karelia
items.summary: A research project on music and Finnish migration to North America and Soviet Karelia from the late 19th century to today is a little-known subject. Now, the Migration Collection of the Migration Institute of Finland is requesting memories for research and archival purposes.
items.source: Finland Today | News in English | finlandtoday.fi

items.title: President Stubb and Wife to Visit Ostrobothnia With Eurovision Contender KAJ
items.summary: Finnish President Alexander Stubb and his spouse, Suzanne Innes-Stubb, will visit Vörå with a population of about 6,000 and Vaasa (about 70,000 inhabitants) in Ostrobothnia on the west coast of Finland next week.
items.source: Finland Today | News in English | finlandtoday.fi
